oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Vinasse: an alternative to lime sulphur for flower thinning?
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Kelderer, Markus
Lardschneider, Ewald
Casera, Claudio
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Crop health, quality, protection
Fruit and berries
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Thinning trials with vinasse in comparison to lime sulphur were carried out for 4 years at different sites in South Tyrol. Beside the thinning effect, the influence on fruit quality, phytotoxic damage on the leaves and the return bloom of treated trees were evaluated. Depending on the dosage the vinasse treatments showed a good thinning effect, but russetting and leave damages were significantly higher in comparison to lime sulphur. Return bloom of vinasse treated trees was lower than of those treated with lime sulphur. In conclusion, vinasse treatments can not substitute lime sulphur for flower thinning in organic apple orchards.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: Kelderer, Markus; Lardschneider, Ewald and Casera, Claudio (2004) Vinasse: an alternative to lime sulphur for flower thinning? [Vinasse: eine Alternative zum Schwefelkalk für die Blütenausdünnung?] In: Boos, Markus (Ed.) Ecofruit - 11th International Conference on Cultivation Technique and Phytopathological Problems in Organic Fruit-Growing: Proceedings to the Conference from 3rd February to 5th February 2004 at Weinsberg/Germany, pp. 163-168.
